result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamal Terrance Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 9/16/22.

miscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant of appellant rights.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Complete parenting classes.
Follow court order in 20FA4951 exactly as written.
DV assessment imposed.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court. Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.
No contact with firearms.

Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all nonwaivable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Court set restitution at zero.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate A Domestic Abuse Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamal Terrance Boyd

records.addlTxt: Assessment for attorney fees and costs in the amount of $1,420.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/29/2022 to pay $50.00 monthly. Final payment due by 02/03/2025.  Failure to pay is a civil judgment.  Th
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    JOSEPH T DOMASK  $1,410.00
of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County, signed and filed.

Defendant Kamal Terrance Boyd appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Kamal Terrance Boyd.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 4 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Follow court order in 20FA4951 exactly as written.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children. 
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- DV assessment imposed.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/16/22.

Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Kamal Terrance Boyd in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record, State requests an adjourned plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Kamal Terrance Boyd in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.   Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kamal Terrance Boyd in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Joseph Domask, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with M.L.M
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kamal Terrance Boyd in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kamal Terrance Boyd in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kamal Terrance Boyd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
